name: Great crested newt survey licence return

components.content:
Before you begin to complete this form you should know or have ready: 

- details of your licence and any accredited agents 

- survey information from when you used licensable methods,  regardless of whether or not you found great crested newts 

- the total number of great crested newts you found or captured at a water body (for example, a pond or lake) using each method across all the surveys there â€“ and the peak count of great crested newts on any one survey

-  the Habitat Suitability Index scores and any records of native amphibians or non-native species, if noted during your surveys

- details of any welfare concerns such as killed or injured newts
Provide the name you are currently registered with at Natural England - you will have the option to change this later in the form

components.title: What level of great crested newt survey class licence are you registered to use?
components.name: xyYjHt

components.content:
You must report your actions from 1 October to 30 September each year. This includes surveys carried out by your accredited agents. An accredited agent is a suitably trained and experienced person who is able to carry out work under a licence without your personal supervision.

Use this form to tell us about the surveys carried out under this licence using licensable methods. The licensable methods for great crested newt survey class licences include:

- disturbing great crested newts using a torch
- taking great crested newts by hand or using nets
- using aquatic funnel traps, including bottle traps, while surveying
- using pitfall traps while surveying

The methods youâ€™re allowed to use depend on which licence level you're registered for. 

You must tell us about all surveys where the licensable methods were used, even if great crested newts were not found. 

You do not need to tell us about surveys:

- that were carried out under a different licence, such as a great crested newt mitigation licence
- where you were an accredited agent on another person's survey class licence

components.title: Did you or your accredited agents carry out surveys where you used the licensable methods?
components.name: vsWJYH

pages.title: Reporting results to the Local Record Centre

components.content:
You are reporting that you have not used any licensable methods under this survey licence in this reporting period. This is a nil return.

We would still encourage you to provide your records to your Local Record Centre. You can do this by recording your results on the [iRecord website](https://irecord.org.uk/) or contacting the [Local Record Centre](https://www.alerc.org.uk/).

You do not need to submit your survey data to Natural England but do need to complete this return.

Select continue to complete the rest of your return.

components.title: Are you submitting survey data for the reporting period 1 October to 30 September only?
components.name: xhiodt
components.shortDescription: Data is for this reporting period
components.hint: This means the period from 1 October last year to 30 September this year, or a shorter range if you were first registered in this reporting period

components.title: Why are you submitting data outside of the reporting period?
components.name: wJKSPp
components.shortDescription: Survey data outside of reporting period
components.hint: For example, you have been asked to provide older survey data from missed licence returns so you can be re-registered

components.title: What is the start date of the period you are reporting for?
components.name: SStfbl
components.hint: For example, 01 01 2025 for 1 January 2025

components.title: What is the end date of the period you are reporting for?
components.name: XDtiJb

components.content:
You should only select the methods where you were using this survey class licence. This includes surveys where no great crested newts were found.

You should not select methods where you:

- were working under a different licence such as a mitigation licence
- were an accredited agent on someone else's licence 
- did not need a licence, for example to rescue an injured great crested newt where the cause of the injury wasn't unlawful

components.title: What licensable methods did you use?
components.name: NtgjNd

pages.title: Pitfall trapping carried out under your CL08 licence

components.content:
Under the conditions of your [CL08 (level 1) great crested newt survey licence](https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/great-crested-newts-survey-or-research-licence-level-1/class-licence-cl08-great-crested-newts-survey-or-research-level-1), you and your accredited agents and assistants are allowed to:

- take great crested newts by hand or using nets
- disturb great crested newts using torches
- use aquatic funnel traps, including bottle traps

You've said that you used pitfall traps, which is not covered by the CL08 licence.

components.title: Why did you use pitfall trapping?
components.name: AuQKwq
components.shortDescription: Pitfall trapping carried out under CL08 licence

components.title: Were any great crested newts injured or killed using pitfall trapping?
components.name: hbVNwE
components.shortDescription: Great crested newts injured or killed when using pitfall trapping
components.hint: If great crested newts were harmed or killed, you must tell us how this happened and the number of great crested newts harmed

components.title: Did you tell Natural England that you planned to start pitfall trapping at least 5 working days before installing fences or traps?
components.name: zXNlOo
components.hint: This is a condition of the CL09 licence

components.content:
You must inform Natural England at least 5 working days before installing fences or pitfall traps. This is detailed in Licence Condition 7 of the [CL09 licence](https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/great-crested-newts-survey-or-research-licence-level-2/great-crested-newts-survey-or-research-licence-level-2-cl09).  

If you did not tell Natural England 5 working days before starting pitfall trapping, you need to:

- explain why you did not tell Natural England before trapping
- show that great crested newt welfare wasnâ€™t harmed, and the favourable conservation status was not affected

components.title: Why did you not give 5 working days' notice before you started pitfall trapping?
components.name: sODJBe

components.title: Were any great crested newts injured or killed using pitfall trapping?
components.name: khbRbr
components.shortDescription: Great crested newts injured or killed using pitfall trapping
components.hint: If great crested newts were injured or killed, you must tell us the number impacted and how this happened

components.content:
You must give the results of all surveys carried out under this class licence that used licensable methods. This includes surveys carried out by accredited agents.

The next page will ask you to summarise the overall survey results for one water body, regardless of the number of survey visits.

You must include:

- all surveys where great crested newts were observed
- all surveys where you searched for great crested newts using one or more of the licensable methods but they were not found - this helps with 'likely absence' data

Do not include surveys that were carried out under a different licence, for example:

- a great crested newt mitigation licence or science and conservation project licence
- where you were an accredited agent on another person's survey class licence

You can add information about killed or injured great crested newts later in this form.

Complete one page for each water body where you or your accredited agents carried out surveys using licensable techniques. You can add more water bodies on the next pages. The button to 'add another' water body is located at the bottom of this page.

You must answer all questions if they apply to you - even if they're marked as 'optional'. You should only leave a question blank if you:
- did not use that method
- do not have the relevant information

## Grid reference

To find your grid reference:

1. Open the free [Ordnance Survey Maps](https://explore.osmaps.com/?lat=54.48471&lon=-0.64347&zoom=12.6715&style=Standard&type=2d) website.
2. In the search bar in the top left corner, type the site location or nearest postcode.
3. Click on the location in the list of results that appears below the search bar.
4. Right click on the site location on the map to find the grid reference.
5. Copy the grid reference from the pop-up box.

## How to enter great crested newt numbers
- For the adult peak count, enter the highest number of adults seen during one survey visit, and specify how many of these were male, female, or of unknown sex
- For the juvenile peak count, enter the highest number of juvenile great crested newts seen during any one survey - this may be from the same survey as the adult peak count, or a different one
- Enter â€˜0â€™ if no great crested newts were present

##

components.content:
As you or your accredited agents used licensable techniques, you must send your survey data to the Local Environmental Record Centre.

You can do this by recording your results on the [iRecord website](https://irecord.org.uk/) or contacting the [Local Record Centre](https://www.alerc.org.uk/).

components.title: Have you submitted your survey results to your Local Environmental Record Centre?
components.name: JwjLBr
components.shortDescription: Survey results sent to records centre

pages.title: Report your survey results by 31 October

components.content:
You must submit survey data collected under this licence to the  [local record centre](https://www.alerc.org.uk/) by no later than 31 October this year. You can do this by recording your results on the [iRecord website](https://irecord.org.uk/)

You may authorise other individuals to submit survey data on your behalf. It is your responsibility as the registered person to make sure that records are accurate and submitted in accordance with the terms of the licence.

components.content:
You must give details of any accredited agents appointed under your licence.

You do not need to include assistants. An assistant is a person working under the direct supervision of the registered person or their accredited agent.

components.title: Do you want to stay registered to use this licence for the year ahead?
components.name: qWXGPe
components.shortDescription: Stay registered for the year ahead
components.hint: You must pay a fee of Â£35 to stay registered unless you are exempt

components.content:
Youâ€™ve said you do not want to stay registered to use this licence for the year ahead. Your registration will end if you do not re-register.

If you want to stay registered, click 'back' at the top of this page to return to the previous question.

If you end your registration:
- during the current registration period, your registration will end on the date you submit the form
- after the registration period has closed, your registration will formally have ended on 31 October this year

You can apply to re-register in the future by visiting the [great crested newt licences](https://www.gov.uk/government/collections/great-crested-newt-licences) and selecting the level of great crested newt survey licence you want to register for.

Click 'continue' to go to the declaration page and submit your form.

You do not need to pay if the licence is only used for:

- voluntary purposes - unpaid voluntary work for an organisation, charity or local recording group
- science or education purposes - paid or unpaid research on the protected species by a student or employee of an academic institution, research organisation, local wildlife group or environmental non-governmental organisation

You must pay if you use the licence for:

- other purposes such as surveys to inform development projects
- a mix of surveys to inform development projects and voluntary purposes or science and education

components.title: How will you use your licence in the year ahead?
components.name: xzoljN
components.shortDescription: How will you use your licence
components.hint: Select all that apply

pages.title: You do not need to pay for your licence

components.content: Click continue to proceed to the declaration and submit your form.

pages.title: You need to pay for your licence

components.content:
Read the [terms and conditions for paying for a wildlife licence](https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/terms-and-conditions-for-paying-for-a-wildlife-licence).

Go to [GOV.UK Pay](https://products.payments.service.gov.uk/pay/a766662a747442e58ef55b1e7874ea9f) to pay for your licence. It costs Â£35 to re-register your licence for another year.

You must return to this form to complete and submit it once you have paid. You will need your payment reference number.

components.title: What is your payment reference number?
components.name: UjJHuq
components.hint: This will be 10 characters long, made up of both letters and numbers

components.content:
By submitting this form, I confirm that:

- I have included details of all surveys where licensable actions were used under this licence, including surveys carried out by accredited agents.

- I declare that the details given in this report are correct to the best of my knowledge and belief.

- I have read and understood the [wildlife licensing privacy notice](https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/natural-england-privacy-notices/wildlife-licensing-privacy-notice).

By selecting 'Accept and send', I agree to these declarations.
